required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of IW-1701, A Stimulator of Soluble Guanylate Cyclase (sGC), in Patients With Type I or II Achalasia
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Single-dose, Phase 2a Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of IW-1701 in Patients With Achalasia

brief_summary.textblock:
The objectives of this study are as follows:
In participants with primary Type I or II achalasia, following a single 5-mg dose of olinciguat (IW-1701),
- To assess the safety and tolerability
- To determine the effects on measures of esophageal function by high-resolution impedance manometry (HRIM)
- To determine the pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters

clinical_study.why_stopped: The study was prematurely terminated due to enrollment challenges.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Deaths, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Adverse Events Resulting in Study Drug Discontinuation (ADOs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Deaths, SAEs, and AEs: from enrollment through end-of-trial visit Day 21 (±7 days). TEAEs: from first dose of study drug through 72 hours postdose.
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence, which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with study treatment. An SAE is any AE occurring at any dose that results in any of the following outcomes: death; life-threatening: the patient was at immediate risk of death from the reaction as it occurred; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly/birth defect; important medical event. Deaths and SAEs include those that occurred on or after the participant signed the informed consent at the Screening Visit through the End-of-Trial Visit. TEAEs are defined as adverse events that occurred on/after administration of the double-blind study drug and within 72 hours after the double-blind study drug administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Supine Bolus Flow Time (BFT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: predose (baseline) and 3 hours (+15 minutes) postdose
primary_outcome.description: Supine BFT defined as the median measurement from the 10 available swallows in supine position as measured by high resolution impedance manometry (HRIM), and determined by the central read (seconds; longer times=more severe achalasia). Change=(postdose supine BFT - predose supine BFT).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Upright BFT
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: predose (baseline) and 3 hours (+15 minutes) postdose
primary_outcome.description: Upright BFT defined as the median measurement from the 5 available swallows in the upright position as measured by HRIM, and determined by the central read (seconds; longer times=more severe achalasia). Change = (postdose upright BFT - predose upright BFT).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Supine Integrated Relaxation Pressure (IRP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: predose (baseline) and 3 hours (+15 minutes) postdose
primary_outcome.description: Supine IRP defined as the median measurement from the 10 available swallows in supine position as determined by the central read (mmHg; higher pressure=more severe achalasia), measured by HRIM. Change = (postdose supine IRP - predose supine IRP).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Upright IRP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: predose (baseline) and 3 hours (+15 minutes) postdose
primary_outcome.description: Upright IRP is defined as the median measurement from the 5 available swallows in the supine position as determined by the central read (mmHg; higher pressure=more severe achalasia), measured by HRIM. Change = (postdose upright IRP - predose upright IRP).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 1 Minute Impedance Bolus Height (IBH)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: predose (baseline) and 3 hours (+15 minutes) postdose
primary_outcome.description: 1 minute IBH defined by the height in esophagus of 200 mL saline bolus 1 minute post-bolus as measured by HRIM and determined by the central read (cm; greater height=more severe achalasia). Change = (postdose height 1 min IBH - predose height 1 min IBH)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 2 Minute IBH
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: predose (baseline) and 3 hours (+15 minutes) postdose
primary_outcome.description: 2 minute IBH defined by the height in esophagus of 200 mL saline bolus 2 minutes post-bolus as measured by HRIM and determined by the central read (cm; greater height=more severe achalasia). Change = (postdose height 2 min IBH - predose height 2 min IBH).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 5 Minute IBH
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: predose (baseline) and 3 hours (+15 minutes) postdose
primary_outcome.description: 5 minute IBH defined by the height in esophagus of 200 mL saline bolus 5 minutes post-bolus as determined by the central read (cm; greater height=more severe achalasia). Change = (postdose height 5 min IBH - predose height 5 min IBH).

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time Curve From Time 0 to the Last Observation (AUClast)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 predose: 0 (≤15 minutes); Day 1 postdose: 0.5 hours (±2 minutes), 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 hours (±5 minutes), 12, 17 hours (±15 minutes). Day 2 postdose 24 hours (±30 minutes). End of Treatment Visit: Day 21 (±7 days).

Day 1 predose: 0 (≤15 minutes); Day 1 postdose: 0.5 hours (±2 minutes), 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 hours (±5 minutes), 12, 17 hours (±15 minutes). Day 2 postdose 24 hours (±30 minutes). End of Treatment Visit: Day 21 (±7 days).

primary_outcome.measure: Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 predose: 0 (≤15 minutes); Day 1 postdose: 0.5 hours (±2 minutes), 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 hours (±5 minutes), 12, 17 hours (±15 minutes). Day 2 postdose 24 hours (±30 minutes). End of Treatment Visit: Day 21 (±7 days).

arm_group.description: Single 5-mg dose of IW-1701 administered orally

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has a diagnosis of primary Type I or II achalasia.
- Patient has no contraindications to the performance of the baseline and postdose HRIM procedures per Investigator discretion.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has had any prior esophageal, periesophageal, or gastric surgery, or treatment with sclerosing agent.
- More than 1 pneumatic dilation procedure to a diameter of > 2 cm in their lifetime.
- Pneumatic dilation procedure to a diameter of > 2 cm within 1 year prior to randomization. Prior bougie dilation(s) or pneumatic dilation(s) ≤ 2 cm are allowed.
- Prior esophageal injection of botulinum toxin (Botox) within 6 months prior to randomization or more than 2 esophageal Botox injection procedures in their lifetime.
- Patients with malignant or premalignant esophageal lesions.
- Patient has taken any drug that can affect gastrointestinal (GI) motility in the 72 hours before check-in through discharge from the clinic.
Other inclusion and exclusion criteria specified in the protocol.

facility.name: Connecticut Clinical Research Foundation, Gastroenterology Institute
Washington University in St. Louis - School of Medicine
University of Utah School of Medicine, Division of Gastroenterology, Hepatology & Nutrition

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Up to 20 participants were planned to be randomized in a 3:1 ratio to receive either olinciguat or matching placebo. The study was prematurely terminated due to enrollment challenges after 9 participants had completed the study.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo administered orally

group.title: Olinciguat
group.description: Single 5-mg dose of olinciguat administered orally

baseline.population: Due to privacy and reidentification concerns (rare disease, small population), the arms are combined for Baseline characteristics, and race and ethnicity data are not provided.

group.title: Placebo or Olinciguat
group.description: Matching placebo administered orally or single 5-mg dose of olinciguat administered orally

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Deaths, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Adverse Events Resulting in Study Drug Discontinuation (ADOs)
outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence, which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with study treatment. An SAE is any AE occurring at any dose that results in any of the following outcomes: death; life-threatening: the patient was at immediate risk of death from the reaction as it occurred; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly/birth defect; important medical event. Deaths and SAEs include those that occurred on or after the participant signed the informed consent at the Screening Visit through the End-of-Trial Visit. TEAEs are defined as adverse events that occurred on/after administration of the double-blind study drug and within 72 hours after the double-blind study drug administration.
outcome.time_frame: Deaths, SAEs, and AEs: from enrollment through end-of-trial visit Day 21 (±7 days). TEAEs: from first dose of study drug through 72 hours postdose.
outcome.population: All participants who received study drug were included in the Safety Population and were evaluated for according to the treatment they actually received.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: PI may publish or disclose the results of the study 24 months after final data lock provided that sponsor can review the publication prior to public release, sponsor can request removal of confidential information of sponsor (not including results of trial), and sponsor can request a publication delay in order to protect potentially patentable information. Furthermore, if a publication committee is developing an initial publication, PI is to delay disclosure until that publication is published.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was prematurely terminated due to enrollment challenges after 9 participants had completed the study. The small number of participants limits the interpretation of study results.
